trans-unit.source: Set up a Hybrid Compute Cluster with Microsoft HPC Pack
trans-unit.target: Set up a Hybrid Compute Cluster with Microsoft HPC Pack

trans-unit.source: Learn how to use Microsoft HPC Pack and Azure to set up a small, hybrid high performance computing (HPC) cluster
trans-unit.target: Learn how to use Microsoft HPC Pack and Azure to set up a small, hybrid high performance computing (HPC) cluster

trans-unit.source: Set up a Hybrid Compute Cluster with Microsoft HPC Pack
trans-unit.target: Set up a Hybrid Compute Cluster with Microsoft HPC Pack

trans-unit.source: This tutorial shows you how to use Microsoft HPC Pack 2012 R2 and Azure to set up a small, hybrid high performance computing (HPC) cluster.
trans-unit.target: This tutorial shows you how to use Microsoft HPC Pack 2012 R2 and Azure to set up a small, hybrid high performance computing (HPC) cluster.

trans-unit.source: The cluster will consist of an on-premises head node (a computer running the Windows Server operating system and HPC Pack) and some compute nodes you deploy on-demand as worker role instances in an Azure cloud service.
trans-unit.target: The cluster will consist of an on-premises head node (a computer running the Windows Server operating system and HPC Pack) and some compute nodes you deploy on-demand as worker role instances in an Azure cloud service.

trans-unit.source: You can then run compute jobs on the hybrid cluster.
trans-unit.target: You can then run compute jobs on the hybrid cluster.

trans-unit.source: Hybrid HPC cluster
trans-unit.target: Hybrid HPC cluster

trans-unit.source: This tutorial shows one approach, sometimes called cluster "burst to the cloud," to use scalable, on-demand compute resources in Azure to run compute intensive applications.
trans-unit.target: This tutorial shows one approach, sometimes called cluster "burst to the cloud," to use scalable, on-demand compute resources in Azure to run compute intensive applications.

trans-unit.source: This tutorial assumes no prior experience with compute clusters or HPC Pack.
trans-unit.target: This tutorial assumes no prior experience with compute clusters or HPC Pack.

trans-unit.source: It is intended only to help you deploy a hybrid compute cluster quickly for demonstration purposes.
trans-unit.target: It is intended only to help you deploy a hybrid compute cluster quickly for demonstration purposes.

trans-unit.source: For considerations and steps to deploy a hybrid HPC Pack cluster at greater scale in a production environment, see the [detailed guidance](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?LinkID=200493).
trans-unit.target: For considerations and steps to deploy a hybrid HPC Pack cluster at greater scale in a production environment, see the [detailed guidance](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?LinkID=200493).

trans-unit.source: If you want to set up an HPC Pack cluster entirely in Azure, see [Microsoft HPC Pack in Azure VMs](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?linkid=330375).
trans-unit.target: If you want to set up an HPC Pack cluster entirely in Azure, see [Microsoft HPC Pack in Azure VMs](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?linkid=330375).

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE] Azure offers a [range of sizes](../virtual-machines/virtual-machines-size-specs.md) for your compute resources, suitable for different workloads.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE] Azure offers a [range of sizes](../virtual-machines/virtual-machines-size-specs.md) for your compute resources, suitable for different workloads.

trans-unit.source: For example, the A8 and A9 instances combine high performance and access to a low latency, high throughput application network needed for certain HPC applications.
trans-unit.target: For example, the A8 and A9 instances combine high performance and access to a low latency, high throughput application network needed for certain HPC applications.

trans-unit.source: See [About the A8, A9, A10, and A11 Compute Intensive Instances](../virtual-machines/virtual-machines-a8-a9-a10-a11-specs.md).
trans-unit.target: See [About the A8, A9, A10, and A11 Compute Intensive Instances](../virtual-machines/virtual-machines-a8-a9-a10-a11-specs.md).

trans-unit.source: Prerequisites
trans-unit.target: Prerequisites

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE]To complete this tutorial, you need an Azure account.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE]To complete this tutorial, you need an Azure account.

trans-unit.source: If you don't have an account, you can create a free trial account in just a couple of minutes.
trans-unit.target: If you don't have an account, you can create a free trial account in just a couple of minutes.

trans-unit.source: For details, see [Create an Azure account](http://azure.microsoft.com/develop/php/tutorials/create-a-windows-azure-account/).
trans-unit.target: For details, see [Create an Azure account](http://azure.microsoft.com/develop/php/tutorials/create-a-windows-azure-account/).

trans-unit.source: In addition, you need the following for this tutorial.
trans-unit.target: In addition, you need the following for this tutorial.

trans-unit.source: An on-premises computer that is running an edition of Windows Server 2012 R2 or Windows Server 2012.
trans-unit.target: An on-premises computer that is running an edition of Windows Server 2012 R2 or Windows Server 2012.

trans-unit.source: This computer will be the head node of the HPC cluster.
trans-unit.target: This computer will be the head node of the HPC cluster.

trans-unit.source: If you are not already running Windows Server, you can download and install an [evaluation version](http://technet.microsoft.com/evalcenter/dn205286.aspx).
trans-unit.target: If you are not already running Windows Server, you can download and install an [evaluation version](http://technet.microsoft.com/evalcenter/dn205286.aspx).

trans-unit.source: The computer must be joined to an Active Directory domain.
trans-unit.target: The computer must be joined to an Active Directory domain.

trans-unit.source: Ensure that no additional server roles or role services are installed.
trans-unit.target: Ensure that no additional server roles or role services are installed.

trans-unit.source: To support HPC Pack, the operating system must be installed in one of these languages: English, Japanese, or Chinese (Simplified).
trans-unit.target: To support HPC Pack, the operating system must be installed in one of these languages: English, Japanese, or Chinese (Simplified).

trans-unit.source: Verify that important and critical updates are installed.
trans-unit.target: Verify that important and critical updates are installed.

trans-unit.source: Installation files for HPC Pack 2012 R2, which is available free of charge.
trans-unit.target: Installation files for HPC Pack 2012 R2, which is available free of charge.

trans-unit.source: [Download](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?linkid=328024) the latest version and copy the files to the head node computer or to a network location.
trans-unit.target: [Download](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?linkid=328024) the latest version and copy the files to the head node computer or to a network location.

trans-unit.source: Choose installation files in the same language as your installation of Windows Server.
trans-unit.target: Choose installation files in the same language as your installation of Windows Server.

trans-unit.source: A domain account with local Administrator permissions on the head node.
trans-unit.target: A domain account with local Administrator permissions on the head node.

trans-unit.source: TCP connectivity on port 443 from the head node to Azure.
trans-unit.target: TCP connectivity on port 443 from the head node to Azure.

trans-unit.source: Install HPC Pack on the head node
trans-unit.target: Install HPC Pack on the head node

trans-unit.source: You first install Microsoft HPC Pack on an on-premises computer running Windows Server that will be the head node of the cluster.
trans-unit.target: You first install Microsoft HPC Pack on an on-premises computer running Windows Server that will be the head node of the cluster.

trans-unit.source: Log on to the head node by using a domain account that has local Administrator permissions.
trans-unit.target: Log on to the head node by using a domain account that has local Administrator permissions.

trans-unit.source: Start the HPC Pack Installation Wizard by running Setup.exe from the HPC Pack installation files.
trans-unit.target: Start the HPC Pack Installation Wizard by running Setup.exe from the HPC Pack installation files.

trans-unit.source: On the **HPC Pack 2012 R2 Setup** screen, click **New installation or add new features to an existing installation**.
trans-unit.target: On the **HPC Pack 2012 R2 Setup** screen, click **New installation or add new features to an existing installation**.

trans-unit.source: HPC Pack 2012 Setup
trans-unit.target: HPC Pack 2012 Setup

trans-unit.source: On the **Microsoft Software User Agreement page**, click **Next**.
trans-unit.target: On the **Microsoft Software User Agreement page**, click **Next**.

trans-unit.source: On the **Select Installation Type** page, click **Create a new HPC cluster by creating a head node**, and then click **Next**.
trans-unit.target: On the **Select Installation Type** page, click **Create a new HPC cluster by creating a head node**, and then click **Next**.

trans-unit.source: Select Installation Type
trans-unit.target: Select Installation Type

trans-unit.source: The wizard runs several pre-installation tests.
trans-unit.target: The wizard runs several pre-installation tests.

trans-unit.source: Click **Next** on the **Installation Rules** page if all tests pass.
trans-unit.target: Click **Next** on the **Installation Rules** page if all tests pass.

trans-unit.source: Otherwise, review the information provided and make any necessary changes in your environment.
trans-unit.target: Otherwise, review the information provided and make any necessary changes in your environment.

trans-unit.source: Then run the tests again or if necessary start the Installation Wizard again.
trans-unit.target: Then run the tests again or if necessary start the Installation Wizard again.

trans-unit.source: Installation Rules
trans-unit.target: Installation Rules

trans-unit.source: On the **HPC DB Configuration** page, make sure **Head Node** is selected for all HPC databases, and then click **Next**.
trans-unit.target: On the **HPC DB Configuration** page, make sure **Head Node** is selected for all HPC databases, and then click **Next**.

trans-unit.source: DB Configuration
trans-unit.target: DB Configuration

trans-unit.source: Accept default selections on the remaining pages of the wizard.
trans-unit.target: Accept default selections on the remaining pages of the wizard.

trans-unit.source: On the **Install Required Components** page, click **Install**.
trans-unit.target: On the **Install Required Components** page, click **Install**.

trans-unit.source: Install
trans-unit.target: Install

trans-unit.source: After the installation completes, uncheck **Start HPC Cluster Manager** and then click **Finish**.
trans-unit.target: After the installation completes, uncheck **Start HPC Cluster Manager** and then click **Finish**.

trans-unit.source: (You will start HPC Cluster Manager in a later step to complete the configuration of the head node.)
trans-unit.target: (You will start HPC Cluster Manager in a later step to complete the configuration of the head node.)

trans-unit.source: Finish
trans-unit.target: Finish

trans-unit.source: Prepare the Azure subscription
trans-unit.target: Prepare the Azure subscription

trans-unit.source: Use the [Azure Management Portal](https://manage.windowsazure.com) to perform the following steps with your Azure subscription.
trans-unit.target: Use the [Azure Management Portal](https://manage.windowsazure.com) to perform the following steps with your Azure subscription.

trans-unit.source: These are needed so you can later deploy Azure nodes from the on-premises head node.
trans-unit.target: These are needed so you can later deploy Azure nodes from the on-premises head node.

trans-unit.source: Upload a management certificate (needed for secure connections between the head node and the Azure services)
trans-unit.target: Upload a management certificate (needed for secure connections between the head node and the Azure services)

trans-unit.source: Create an Azure cloud service in which Azure nodes (worker role instances) will run
trans-unit.target: Create an Azure cloud service in which Azure nodes (worker role instances) will run

trans-unit.source: Create an Azure storage account
trans-unit.target: Create an Azure storage account

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE]Also make a note of your Azure subscription ID, which you will need later.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE]Also make a note of your Azure subscription ID, which you will need later.

trans-unit.source: Find this in your Azure account information.
trans-unit.target: Find this in your Azure account information.

trans-unit.source: Upload the default management certificate
trans-unit.target: Upload the default management certificate

trans-unit.source: HPC Pack installs a self-signed certificate on the head node, called the Default Microsoft HPC Azure Management certificate, that you can upload as an Azure management certificate.
trans-unit.target: HPC Pack installs a self-signed certificate on the head node, called the Default Microsoft HPC Azure Management certificate, that you can upload as an Azure management certificate.

trans-unit.source: This certificate is provided for testing purposes and proof-of-concept deployments.
trans-unit.target: This certificate is provided for testing purposes and proof-of-concept deployments.

trans-unit.source: From the head node computer, sign in to the [Azure portal](https://manage.windowsazure.com).
trans-unit.target: From the head node computer, sign in to the [Azure portal](https://manage.windowsazure.com).

trans-unit.source: Click **Settings**, and then click **Management Certificates**.
trans-unit.target: Click **Settings**, and then click **Management Certificates**.

trans-unit.source: On the command bar, click **Upload**.
trans-unit.target: On the command bar, click **Upload**.

trans-unit.source: Certificate Settings
trans-unit.target: Certificate Settings

trans-unit.source: Browse on the head node for the file C:\Program Files\Microsoft HPC Pack 2012\Bin\hpccert.cer.
trans-unit.target: Browse on the head node for the file C:\Program Files\Microsoft HPC Pack 2012\Bin\hpccert.cer.

trans-unit.source: Then, click the **Check** button.
trans-unit.target: Then, click the **Check** button.

trans-unit.source: Upload Certificate
trans-unit.target: Upload Certificate

trans-unit.source: You will see **Default HPC Azure Management** in the list of management certificates.
trans-unit.target: You will see **Default HPC Azure Management** in the list of management certificates.

trans-unit.source: Create an Azure cloud service
trans-unit.target: Create an Azure cloud service

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE]For best performance, create the cloud service and the storage account in the same geographic region.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE]For best performance, create the cloud service and the storage account in the same geographic region.

trans-unit.source: In the portal, on the command bar, click **New**.
trans-unit.target: In the portal, on the command bar, click **New**.

trans-unit.source: Click **Compute**, click **Cloud Service**, and then click **Quick Create**.
trans-unit.target: Click **Compute**, click **Cloud Service**, and then click **Quick Create**.

trans-unit.source: Type a URL for the cloud service, and then click **Create Cloud Service**.
trans-unit.target: Type a URL for the cloud service, and then click **Create Cloud Service**.

trans-unit.source: Create Service
trans-unit.target: Create Service

trans-unit.source: Create an Azure storage account
trans-unit.target: Create an Azure storage account

trans-unit.source: In the portal, on the command bar, click **New**.
trans-unit.target: In the portal, on the command bar, click **New**.

trans-unit.source: Click **Data Services**, click **Storage**, and then click **Quick Create**.
trans-unit.target: Click **Data Services**, click **Storage**, and then click **Quick Create**.

trans-unit.source: Type a URL for the account, and then click **Create Storage Account**.
trans-unit.target: Type a URL for the account, and then click **Create Storage Account**.

trans-unit.source: Create Storage
trans-unit.target: Create Storage

trans-unit.source: Configure the head node
trans-unit.target: Configure the head node

trans-unit.source: To use HPC Cluster Manager to deploy Azure nodes and to submit jobs, first perform some required cluster configuration steps.
trans-unit.target: To use HPC Cluster Manager to deploy Azure nodes and to submit jobs, first perform some required cluster configuration steps.

trans-unit.source: On the head node, start HPC Cluster Manager.
trans-unit.target: On the head node, start HPC Cluster Manager.

trans-unit.source: If the **Select Head Node** dialog box appears, click **Local Computer**.
trans-unit.target: If the **Select Head Node** dialog box appears, click **Local Computer**.

trans-unit.source: The **Deployment To-do List** appears.
trans-unit.target: The **Deployment To-do List** appears.

trans-unit.source: Under **Required deployment tasks**, click **Configure your network**.
trans-unit.target: Under **Required deployment tasks**, click **Configure your network**.

trans-unit.source: Configure Network
trans-unit.target: Configure Network

trans-unit.source: In the Network Configuration Wizard, select **All nodes only on an enterprise network** (Topology 5).
trans-unit.target: In the Network Configuration Wizard, select **All nodes only on an enterprise network** (Topology 5).

trans-unit.source: Topology 5
trans-unit.target: Topology 5

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE]This is the simplest configuration for demonstration purposes, because the head node only needs a single network adapter to connect to Active Directory and the Internet.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE]This is the simplest configuration for demonstration purposes, because the head node only needs a single network adapter to connect to Active Directory and the Internet.

trans-unit.source: This tutorial does not cover cluster scenarios that require additional networks.
trans-unit.target: This tutorial does not cover cluster scenarios that require additional networks.

trans-unit.source: Click **Next** to accept default values on the remaining pages of the wizard.
trans-unit.target: Click **Next** to accept default values on the remaining pages of the wizard.

trans-unit.source: Then, on the **Review** tab, click **Configure** to complete the network configuration.
trans-unit.target: Then, on the **Review** tab, click **Configure** to complete the network configuration.

trans-unit.source: In the **Deployment To-do List**, click **Provide installation credentials**.
trans-unit.target: In the **Deployment To-do List**, click **Provide installation credentials**.

trans-unit.source: In the **Installation Credentials** dialog box, type the credentials of the domain account that you used to install HPC Pack.
trans-unit.target: In the **Installation Credentials** dialog box, type the credentials of the domain account that you used to install HPC Pack.

trans-unit.source: Then click **OK**.
trans-unit.target: Then click **OK**.

trans-unit.source: Installation Credentials
trans-unit.target: Installation Credentials

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE]HPC Pack services only use installation credentials to deploy domain-joined compute nodes.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE]HPC Pack services only use installation credentials to deploy domain-joined compute nodes.

trans-unit.source: The Azure nodes you add in this tutorial are not domain-joined.
trans-unit.target: The Azure nodes you add in this tutorial are not domain-joined.

trans-unit.source: In the **Deployment To-do List**, click **Configure the naming of new nodes**.
trans-unit.target: In the **Deployment To-do List**, click **Configure the naming of new nodes**.

trans-unit.source: In the **Specify Node Naming Series** dialog box, accept the default naming series and click **OK**.
trans-unit.target: In the **Specify Node Naming Series** dialog box, accept the default naming series and click **OK**.

trans-unit.source: Node Naming
trans-unit.target: Node Naming

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE]The naming series only generates names for domain-joined compute nodes.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE]The naming series only generates names for domain-joined compute nodes.

trans-unit.source: Azure nodes are named automatically.
trans-unit.target: Azure nodes are named automatically.

trans-unit.source: In the **Deployment To-do List**, click **Create a node template**.
trans-unit.target: In the **Deployment To-do List**, click **Create a node template**.

trans-unit.source: You will use the node template to add Azure nodes to the cluster.
trans-unit.target: You will use the node template to add Azure nodes to the cluster.

trans-unit.source: In the Create Node Template Wizard, do the following:
trans-unit.target: In the Create Node Template Wizard, do the following:

trans-unit.source: a.
trans-unit.target: a.

trans-unit.source: On the **Choose Node Template Type** page, click **Azure node template**, and then click **Next**.
trans-unit.target: On the **Choose Node Template Type** page, click **Azure node template**, and then click **Next**.

trans-unit.source: Node Template
trans-unit.target: Node Template

trans-unit.source: b.
trans-unit.target: b.

trans-unit.source: Click **Next** to accept the default template name.
trans-unit.target: Click **Next** to accept the default template name.

trans-unit.source: c.
trans-unit.target: c.

trans-unit.source: On the **Provide Subscription Information** page, enter your Azure subscription ID (available in your Azure account information).
trans-unit.target: On the **Provide Subscription Information** page, enter your Azure subscription ID (available in your Azure account information).

trans-unit.source: Then, in **Management certificate**, click **Browse** and select **Default HPC Azure Management.** Then click **Next**.
trans-unit.target: Then, in **Management certificate**, click **Browse** and select **Default HPC Azure Management.** Then click **Next**.

trans-unit.source: Node Template
trans-unit.target: Node Template

trans-unit.source: d.
trans-unit.target: d.

trans-unit.source: On the **Provide Service Information** page, select the cloud service and the storage account that you created in a previous step.
trans-unit.target: On the **Provide Service Information** page, select the cloud service and the storage account that you created in a previous step.

trans-unit.source: Then click **Next**.
trans-unit.target: Then click **Next**.

trans-unit.source: Node Template
trans-unit.target: Node Template

trans-unit.source: e.
trans-unit.target: e.

trans-unit.source: Click **Next** to accept default values on the remaining pages of the wizard.
trans-unit.target: Click **Next** to accept default values on the remaining pages of the wizard.

trans-unit.source: Then, on the **Review** tab, click **Create** to create the node template.
trans-unit.target: Then, on the **Review** tab, click **Create** to create the node template.

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE]By default, the Azure node template includes settings for you to start (provision) and stop the nodes manually.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE]By default, the Azure node template includes settings for you to start (provision) and stop the nodes manually.

trans-unit.source: You can also configure a schedule to start and stop the Azure nodes automatically.
trans-unit.target: You can also configure a schedule to start and stop the Azure nodes automatically.

trans-unit.source: Add Azure nodes to the cluster
trans-unit.target: Add Azure nodes to the cluster

trans-unit.source: You now use the node template to add Azure nodes to the cluster.
trans-unit.target: You now use the node template to add Azure nodes to the cluster.

trans-unit.source: Adding the nodes to the cluster stores their configuration information so that you can start (provision) them at any time as role instances in the cloud service.
trans-unit.target: Adding the nodes to the cluster stores their configuration information so that you can start (provision) them at any time as role instances in the cloud service.

trans-unit.source: Your subscription only gets charged for Azure nodes after the role instances are running in the cloud service.
trans-unit.target: Your subscription only gets charged for Azure nodes after the role instances are running in the cloud service.

trans-unit.source: For this tutorial you will add two Small nodes.
trans-unit.target: For this tutorial you will add two Small nodes.

trans-unit.source: In HPC Cluster Manager, in **Node Management**, in the **Actions** pane, click **Add Node**.
trans-unit.target: In HPC Cluster Manager, in **Node Management**, in the **Actions** pane, click **Add Node**.

trans-unit.source: Add Node
trans-unit.target: Add Node

trans-unit.source: In the Add Node Wizard, on the **Select Deployment Method** page, click **Add Azure nodes**, and then click **Next**.
trans-unit.target: In the Add Node Wizard, on the **Select Deployment Method** page, click **Add Azure nodes**, and then click **Next**.

trans-unit.source: Add Azure Node
trans-unit.target: Add Azure Node

trans-unit.source: On the **Specify New Nodes** page, select the Azure node template you created previously (called by default **Default AzureNode Template**).
trans-unit.target: On the **Specify New Nodes** page, select the Azure node template you created previously (called by default **Default AzureNode Template**).

trans-unit.source: Then specify **2** nodes of size **Small**, and then click **Next**.
trans-unit.target: Then specify **2** nodes of size **Small**, and then click **Next**.

trans-unit.source: Specify Nodes
trans-unit.target: Specify Nodes

trans-unit.source: For details about the available virtual machine sizes, see [Virtual Machine and Cloud Service Sizes for Azure](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/azure/dn197896.aspx).
trans-unit.target: For details about the available virtual machine sizes, see [Virtual Machine and Cloud Service Sizes for Azure](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/azure/dn197896.aspx).

trans-unit.source: On the **Completing the Add Node Wizard** page, click **Finish**.
trans-unit.target: On the **Completing the Add Node Wizard** page, click **Finish**.

trans-unit.source: Two Azure nodes, named **AzureCN-0001** and **AzureCN-0002**, now appear in HPC Cluster Manager.
trans-unit.target: Two Azure nodes, named **AzureCN-0001** and **AzureCN-0002**, now appear in HPC Cluster Manager.

trans-unit.source: They are both in the **Not-Deployed** state.
trans-unit.target: They are both in the **Not-Deployed** state.

trans-unit.source: Added Nodes
trans-unit.target: Added Nodes

trans-unit.source: the Azure nodes
trans-unit.target: the Azure nodes

trans-unit.source: When you want to use the cluster resources in Azure, use HPC Cluster Manager to start (provision) the Azure nodes and bring them online.
trans-unit.target: When you want to use the cluster resources in Azure, use HPC Cluster Manager to start (provision) the Azure nodes and bring them online.

trans-unit.source: In HPC Cluster Manager, in **Node Management**, click one or both nodes and then, in the **Actions** pane, click **Start**.
trans-unit.target: In HPC Cluster Manager, in **Node Management**, click one or both nodes and then, in the **Actions** pane, click **Start**.

trans-unit.source: Start Nodes
trans-unit.target: Start Nodes

trans-unit.source: In the **Start Azure Nodes** dialog box, click **Start**.
trans-unit.target: In the **Start Azure Nodes** dialog box, click **Start**.

trans-unit.source: Start Nodes
trans-unit.target: Start Nodes

trans-unit.source: The nodes transition to the **Provisioning** state.
trans-unit.target: The nodes transition to the **Provisioning** state.

trans-unit.source: You can view the provisioning log to track the provisioning progress.
trans-unit.target: You can view the provisioning log to track the provisioning progress.

trans-unit.source: Provision Nodes
trans-unit.target: Provision Nodes

trans-unit.source: After a few minutes, the Azure nodes finish provisioning and are in the **Offline** state.
trans-unit.target: After a few minutes, the Azure nodes finish provisioning and are in the **Offline** state.

trans-unit.source: In this state the role instances are running but will not yet accept cluster jobs.
trans-unit.target: In this state the role instances are running but will not yet accept cluster jobs.

trans-unit.source: To confirm that the role instances are running, in the [portal](https://manage.windowsazure.com), click **Cloud Services**, click the name of your cloud service, and then click **Instances**.
trans-unit.target: To confirm that the role instances are running, in the [portal](https://manage.windowsazure.com), click **Cloud Services**, click the name of your cloud service, and then click **Instances**.

trans-unit.source: Running Instances
trans-unit.target: Running Instances

trans-unit.source: You will see two worker role instances are running in the service.
trans-unit.target: You will see two worker role instances are running in the service.

trans-unit.source: HPC Pack also automatically deploys two **HpcProxy** instances (size Medium) to handle communication between the head node and Azure.
trans-unit.target: HPC Pack also automatically deploys two **HpcProxy** instances (size Medium) to handle communication between the head node and Azure.

trans-unit.source: To bring the Azure nodes online to run cluster jobs, select the nodes, right-click, and then click **Bring Online**.
trans-unit.target: To bring the Azure nodes online to run cluster jobs, select the nodes, right-click, and then click **Bring Online**.

trans-unit.source: Offline Nodes
trans-unit.target: Offline Nodes

trans-unit.source: HPC Cluster Manager indicates that the nodes are in the **Online** state.
trans-unit.target: HPC Cluster Manager indicates that the nodes are in the **Online** state.

trans-unit.source: Run a command across the cluster
trans-unit.target: Run a command across the cluster

trans-unit.source: You can use the HPC Pack **clusrun** command to run a command or application on one or more cluster nodes.
trans-unit.target: You can use the HPC Pack **clusrun** command to run a command or application on one or more cluster nodes.

trans-unit.source: As a simple example, use **clusrun** to get the IP configuration of the Azure nodes.
trans-unit.target: As a simple example, use **clusrun** to get the IP configuration of the Azure nodes.

trans-unit.source: On the head node, open a command prompt.
trans-unit.target: On the head node, open a command prompt.

trans-unit.source: Type the following command:
trans-unit.target: Type the following command:

trans-unit.source: You will see output similar to the following.
trans-unit.target: You will see output similar to the following.

trans-unit.source: Clusrun
trans-unit.target: Clusrun

trans-unit.source: Run a test job
trans-unit.target: Run a test job

trans-unit.source: You can submit a test job that runs on the hybrid cluster.
trans-unit.target: You can submit a test job that runs on the hybrid cluster.

trans-unit.source: This example is a simple "parametric sweep" job (a type of intrinsically parallel computation) which runs subtasks that add an integer to itself by using the **set /a** command.
trans-unit.target: This example is a simple "parametric sweep" job (a type of intrinsically parallel computation) which runs subtasks that add an integer to itself by using the **set /a** command.

trans-unit.source: All the nodes in the cluster contribute to finishing the subtasks for integers from 1 to 100.
trans-unit.target: All the nodes in the cluster contribute to finishing the subtasks for integers from 1 to 100.

trans-unit.source: In HPC Cluster Manager, in **Job Management**, in the **Actions** pane, click **New Parametric Sweep Job**.
trans-unit.target: In HPC Cluster Manager, in **Job Management**, in the **Actions** pane, click **New Parametric Sweep Job**.

trans-unit.source: New Job
trans-unit.target: New Job

trans-unit.source: In the **New Parametric Sweep Job** dialog box, in **Command line**, type `set /a *+*` (overwriting the default command line that appears).
trans-unit.target: In the **New Parametric Sweep Job** dialog box, in **Command line**, type `set /a *+*` (overwriting the default command line that appears).

trans-unit.source: Leave default values for the remaining settings, and then click **Submit** to submit the job.
trans-unit.target: Leave default values for the remaining settings, and then click **Submit** to submit the job.

trans-unit.source: Parametric Sweep
trans-unit.target: Parametric Sweep

trans-unit.source: When the job is finished, double-click the **My Sweep Task** job.
trans-unit.target: When the job is finished, double-click the **My Sweep Task** job.

trans-unit.source: Click **View Tasks**, and then click a subtask to view the calculated output of that subtask.
trans-unit.target: Click **View Tasks**, and then click a subtask to view the calculated output of that subtask.

trans-unit.source: Task Results
trans-unit.target: Task Results

trans-unit.source: To see which node performed the calculation for that subtask, click **Allocated Nodes**.
trans-unit.target: To see which node performed the calculation for that subtask, click **Allocated Nodes**.

trans-unit.source: (Your cluster might show a different node name.)
trans-unit.target: (Your cluster might show a different node name.)

trans-unit.source: Task Results
trans-unit.target: Task Results

trans-unit.source: Stop the Azure nodes
trans-unit.target: Stop the Azure nodes

trans-unit.source: After you try out the cluster, you can use HPC Cluster Manager to stop the Azure nodes to avoid unnecessary charges to your account.
trans-unit.target: After you try out the cluster, you can use HPC Cluster Manager to stop the Azure nodes to avoid unnecessary charges to your account.

trans-unit.source: This stops the cloud service and removes the Azure role instances.
trans-unit.target: This stops the cloud service and removes the Azure role instances.

trans-unit.source: In HPC Cluster Manager, in **Node Management,** select both Azure nodes.
trans-unit.target: In HPC Cluster Manager, in **Node Management,** select both Azure nodes.

trans-unit.source: Then, in the **Actions** pane, click **Stop**.
trans-unit.target: Then, in the **Actions** pane, click **Stop**.

trans-unit.source: Stop Nodes
trans-unit.target: Stop Nodes

trans-unit.source: In the **Stop Azure Nodes** dialog box, click **Stop**.
trans-unit.target: In the **Stop Azure Nodes** dialog box, click **Stop**.

trans-unit.source: Stop Nodes
trans-unit.target: Stop Nodes

trans-unit.source: The nodes transition to the **Stopping** state.
trans-unit.target: The nodes transition to the **Stopping** state.

trans-unit.source: After a few minutes, HPC Cluster Manager shows that the nodes are **Not-Deployed**.
trans-unit.target: After a few minutes, HPC Cluster Manager shows that the nodes are **Not-Deployed**.

trans-unit.source: Not Deployed Nodes
trans-unit.target: Not Deployed Nodes

trans-unit.source: To confirm that the role instances are no longer running in Azure, in the [classic portal](https://manage.windowsazure.com), click **Cloud Services**, click the name of your cloud service, and then click **Instances**.
trans-unit.target: To confirm that the role instances are no longer running in Azure, in the [classic portal](https://manage.windowsazure.com), click **Cloud Services**, click the name of your cloud service, and then click **Instances**.

trans-unit.source: No instances will be deployed in the production environment.
trans-unit.target: No instances will be deployed in the production environment.

trans-unit.source: No Instances
trans-unit.target: No Instances

trans-unit.source: This completes the tutorial.
trans-unit.target: This completes the tutorial.

trans-unit.source: Related resources
trans-unit.target: Related resources

trans-unit.source: HPC Pack 2012 R2 and HPC Pack 2012
trans-unit.target: HPC Pack 2012 R2 and HPC Pack 2012

trans-unit.source: Burst to Azure with Microsoft HPC Pack
trans-unit.target: Burst to Azure with Microsoft HPC Pack

trans-unit.source: Microsoft HPC Pack in Azure VMs
trans-unit.target: Microsoft HPC Pack in Azure VMs

trans-unit.source: Big Compute in Azure: Technical Resources for Batch and High Performance Computing (HPC)
trans-unit.target: Big Compute in Azure: Technical Resources for Batch and High Performance Computing (HPC)

trans-unit.source: test
trans-unit.target: test
